name: Embassy Circle Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned last night from a weekend with Laura, Raymond, Angela, Bennie and a cast of staff and other guests at Embassy Circle Guest House and had we not gotten in so late last night and been so tired, I would have written then. The weekend truly could not have been better and I already am trying to figure out when we can go back! Having stayed at a number of B&Bs in my travels, I can honestly say that I have never been made to feel so at home and a part of the family. From the personal and sincere conversations to the homemade appetizers and breakfasts; the incredibly restored home to the personally selected artwork and furniture; the amazing location to the surrounding attractions - I simply cannot imagine a better or more complete destination. This is most certainly a trip worth taking!
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was perfect here. The renovation of the building was outstanding. It was close to cute shops, restaurants and the train. We met interesting people from all over the world. The wine happy hour at night the perfect way to meet other guests. I would definitely return here.
reviews.title: Best B&B I've ever stayed at!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i came to Washington for my Birthday
reviews.title: Home away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We certainly mąde the right choice at Embassy Circle .
reviews.title: Hospitality at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both Laura and Raymond the owners mąkę their guests
reviews.title: What can we say!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Superlatives abound when you read the reviews about the Embassy Circle Guest House. Having stayed there for 4 nights in Nov/Dec 2012, I know them to be all true.
reviews.title: It's all true...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is convenient and safe, the home is beautifully decorated and serves delicious breakfasts, but most importantly, the hosts, Raymond and Laura, are gracious and welcoming. They were able to give us advice on public transport, places to visit and the best restaurants to try, say, if we wanted to have foie gras or tuna tartare. This goodwill that is shown by Raymond and Laura and their team promotes goodwill amongst their guests as well. We looked forward to breakfasts when we could share a little of our experiences with people from all around the world.
reviews.title: A perfect place to stay in D.C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Thank you for a wonderful time in DC. We'll be back if we're ever in town again.
reviews.title: Lovely Accomodation, Great Conversation, Delicious Food, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our stay at the Embassy Circle Guest House was fabulous. It's situated on a street lined with various embassies (hence the name). We stayed for 2 nights and wished we could have stayed longer. The house is comprised of large, beautiful rooms filled with luxurious Victorian-style furniture. Each room had a signature piece of art which was really cool. We stayed in the Ivory Esfahan room and it was lovely. Laura and Raymond were great hosts. They were readily available to answer any questions or share a glass of wine. The breakfasts were equally impressive. There was a lot of variety, everything was fresh and the food freshly made when you sat down. And breakfast went on until 10am which was nice as most bnbs stop serving breakfast much earlier. Overall a wonderful stay and will definitely stay here again on my next trip to D.C.
reviews.title: American hospitality at its Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have stayed in many places around the world but none have ticked all the boxes the way this B&B did. The rooms were luxuriously appointed. Nestled amongst beautiful homes and foreign Embassys you always felt very safe, even at night. The location was also extremely convenient to shops, restaurants, Embassy road, public transportation and tourist attractions. However, it was the extras provided by the staff where this B&B was truly outstanding. A marvellous welcome upon arrival - being greeted with a cup of tea is always important to an Australian! The wine and cheese discussions in the evening with heaps of vigorous "liberal" politics debate with Laura (A good glass of red after a lot of walking, again very important to Aussies!) . Great tourist advice and eating recommendations. Fresh and simple breakfasts with the host and other guests around the dining table in the morning. I cannot more highly recommend this establishment, if you are staying for a few nights in Washington. Thank-you Laura, Raymond and Angela, if and when I return I will definitely stay at this wonderful location again!
reviews.title: Superlatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hospitality that Laura and Raymond showed us at their wonderful home last week was outstanding. It doesn't seem right to call The Embassy a guest house, as that seems too impersonal.
reviews.title: #1 for good reason

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The interaction with the owners and other guests was invaluable to our enjoyment of Washington. We found out where to visit, where to eat and where to drink, and enjoyed every second of our stay.
reviews.title: Recent stay At Embassy Guest House, Washington DC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love the US, and have always found the people to be so friendly, especially when compared to here in the UK, but you truly have raised the bar! And Raymond running us to the airport when the taxi failed to show was the icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Perfect Washington Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wish you all the best for the future, and will definitely return someday.
reviews.title: Great hosts, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks once again,
reviews.title: Truly wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Last weekend we visited DC and stayed with Laura and Raymond. It was wonderful and we appreciate that they opened their home to us! Beautiful inn, new friends, great laughs and most of all fantastic hospitality! Thank you to you both for making our anniversary special...we don't often get to escape, therefore it means the world to us. We especially enjoyed breakfast at the inn, it was a treat to sit and relax in the morning! Best wishes today and always!
reviews.title: Great City Escape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Embassy Circle Guest House was a couple of nights longer than expected as a result of the after-affects of Hurricane Sandy. We had to leave New York a few days early, however Laura and her staff were able to accomodate us at short notice, for which we were most grateful. The quality and comfort of our room and the guest common rooms made for a stay that was hard to leave once our time in Washington came to an end. The close proximity to a dozen or so first-class restaurants made for an enjoyable dining experience every evening. Breakfast every morning was a relaxed affair, either with other guests or with Laura, Betty, Angela or Kelly. Making you feel a welcome part of the family seems to be second nature with all of them. Whilst it may be a little while before we get back to Laura and her team, I'm sure it will feel like we never left.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation in a fantastic location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Embassy Circle Guest House is everything you could wish for. Laura and her staff take care of you in everyway possible. The house is very comfortable and the room we stayed in was lovely. It was a pleasure to meet the other guests every morning over a delicious breakfast to discuss our plans for the day and then to get together in the evening for a glass of wine and relaxation. Laura made dinner reservations for us almost every evening at local restaurants and the food was superb at all of them. We were so well taken care of, we would advise anyone planning a trip to Washington to stay here. It is in a safe convenient neighborhood and easy walking distance to many interesting sights.
reviews.title: A Warm Welcome and Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Embassy Circle Guest House is a member of Select Registry and truly lives up to its honor. This welcoming guest house is very well maintained, clean and managed professionally by its lovely, organized staff. I greatly admired the preserved common areas featuring guest art, pleasantly decorated guest rooms and the convenient location in the heart of DC.
reviews.title: Select Registry Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right from the start - the booking process online and friendly responses our experience in dealing with this gorgeous guest house surpassed our expectations. This was further cemented when we arrived at the property and shown to our very comfortable and elegant room (room 134). The hosts, Laura and Raymond and their team (Betty and Kelly) are what really makes this experience truly great. The effort they go to, to make all guests welcome is like nothing we have experienced before. They join us at the communal breakfast table each morning taking great care to introduce all guests. In the evening they host wine and snacks with great conversation. The guest house is located within a very easy 10 minute walk from DuPont Circle subway. A great range of restaurants within easy walking distance. Fantastic service.
reviews.title: Great hosts and gorgeous accommodation

description: Visit our historic and elegant Washington DC bed and breakfast, steps to the metro, shops & dining in Dupont Circle. Enjoy complimentary breakfast, afternoon wine & snacks, parking & internet access at our Dupont Circle inn. Our Washington DC B&B is centrally located with easy access to the famed monuments and sights of our Nation’s Capital. If you are looking for the perfect bed and breakfast in DC, look no further than Embassy Circle!
